race.name: Lopunny
entries: Graceful, beautiful, and rather short, these naturally timid bipedal lagomorphs resemble rabbits with long ears and fluffy fur.

entries.name: Age
entries: Bunearies reach maturity and develop into Lopunnies at 2 years and can live for approximately 12 years.

entries.name: Alignment
entries: Lopunnies usually lean toward neutral or lawful alignments, though mostly neutral.

entries.name: Size
entries: The average height for a Lopunny is barely 4 feet tall and usually weighs a little over 70 lbs. Your size is Small.

entries.name: Darkvision
entries: You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can’t discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

entries.name: Timid Nature
entries: You have disadvantage on saving throws against being frightened.

entries.name: Burst of Speed
entries: When you take the Dash action, you can move an additional 10 feet.

entries.name: Leg Up
entries: You have proficiency with using your legs to perform unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal 1d4 bludgeoning damage + your Strength or Dexterity modifier (your choice).

entries.name: Cute Charm
entries: You have proficiency in the {@skill Persuasion} skill.

entries.name: Limber
entries: You have advantage on saving throws against being paralyzed.

entries.name: Heightened Hearing
entries: Whenever you make a Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) check that involves hearing, you are considered proficient in the {@skill Perception} skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

entries.name: Languages
entries: You can speak, read, and write Common and your choice of Elvish or Sylvan.
Graceful and cautious, Lopunnies are timid lagomorphs who prefer to flee danger but can deliver powerful kicks when forced to fight.

entries.name: History
entries: Lopunnies, along with their Buneary young, originated from the forests of the Sinnoh region, though they can be found almost anywhere. They are favorites among coordinators and contest participants due to their charm.

entries.name: Society
entries: Lopunnies usually live in colonies, caring for their young. They shed their fur twice a year, which is often collected and used in clothing.

entries.name: Names
entries: Despite appearing feminine, Lopunnies can be either male or female. Their names are usually Common or Elvish.
